page.title: 19The Coming of the Mink
page.content: An{unwelcome newcomer}to our area is the{mink}.It was first{introduced}into this country{from the USA}in{1929},to be kept in captivity,and to be bred for its fur. Some{escaped,}or were released on purpose,and{wild mink}were first seen in this area{5 or 6 years ago. A relative of the{weasel,}the mink is a{carnivore,}eating eggs, young birds,rabbits,even kittens.Each male likes a 1 mile territory, and they{live in holes}along our river banks.They can be{very destructive - this year all the eggs were taken from our mallard's nest,just before they were due to hatch-and they take more than they need.Their{only enemy}in this country is{man},they are difficult to trap,and can rear{2 or 3 young each year. Their numbers are {increasing,}AND they are beginning to {upset the local balance of nature .
